title: Chaco Culture National Historical Park: Permits & Reservations
body: Permits & Reservations       Special Use Permits Professional Photography/Filming Permits are issued for photography, filming and associated sound recording to ensure protection of resources, to prevent significant disruption of normal visitor uses, or when they involve props, models, professional crews and casts or set dressings. Permits are required for after-hour access and to access areas normally closed to the visiting public. Other special use activities can use 10-930 form or the 10-930s form.   The contact person for Chaco Culture is Chief Ranger Kyle Lehmkuhl. He can be reached at 505-786-7014 x 231.  10-930 Standard Special Use Permit Application 10-930s Application for Special Use Permit 10-931 Application for Special Use Permit Commercial Filming/Still Photography 10-932 Long Application for Commercial Filming/Still Photography Filming Information Sheet 2016
